paper_abstract: We present algorithms for extracting an image-space representation of object structure from video and using it to synthesize physically plausible animations of objects responding to new, previously unseen forces. Our representation of structure is derived from an image-space analysis of modal object deformation: projections of an object's resonant modes are recovered from the temporal spectra of optical flow in a video, and used as a basis for the image-space simulation of object dynamics. We describe how to extract this basis from video, and show that it can be used to create physically-plausible animations of objects without any knowledge of scene geometry or material properties.
paper_title: Image-Space Modal Bases for Plausible Manipulation of Objects in Video
